traits.name: Unique
traits.text: A rules element with this trait is one-of-a-kind. The DC of Recall Knowledge checks related to creatures with this trait is increased by 10.

traits.name: Human
traits.text: A creature with this trait is a member of the human ancestry. Humans are a diverse array of people known for their adaptability. An ability with this trait can be used or selected only by humans.

traits.name: Humanoid
traits.text: Humanoid creatures reason and act much like humans. They typically stand upright and have two arms and two legs.

gear.name: +2 greater resilient greater cold-resistant full plate

automatic_abilities.name: Battle Arrogance
automatic_abilities.text: Ordulf hasn't met a significant combat challenge in ages, and even when facing deadly foes like the PCs his arrogance can be used against him. If a PC successfully disarms, feints, frightens, or trips Ordulf, his arrogance gets the better of him and he grows sloppy in his tactics, reducing his AC to 34 until the start of his next turn. A PC can also attempt to issue a more debilitating insult to Ordulf, as detailed in Insulting Ordulf.

automatic_abilities.name: Gorum's Major Boon

traits.name: Healing
traits.text: A healing effect restores a creature’s body, typically by restoring Hit Points, but sometimes by removing diseases or other debilitating effects.

automatic_abilities.text: When Ordulf is reduced to 0 Hit Points, Gorum feeds him the zeal of his Aesir, allowing Ordulf to draw upon his own life force to fight on and on without falling. He is healed to 150 Hit Points and becomes doomed 1 (or increases his doomed condition by 1), causing his features to look progressively more gaunt and scarred. Once he reaches doomed 4, he dies.

traits.name: Magical
traits.text: Something with the magical trait is imbued with magical energies not tied to a specific tradition of magic. Some items or effects are closely tied to a particular tradition of magic. In these cases, the item has the arcane, divine, occult, or primal trait instead of the magical trait. Any of these traits indicate that the item is magical.

traits.name: Versatile
traits.text: A versatile weapon can be used to deal a different type of damage than its listed type. This trait indicates the alternate damage type. For instance, a piercing weapon with versatile S can deal piercing or slashing damage. You choose the damage type each time you attack.

traits.name: Magical
traits.text: Something with the magical trait is imbued with magical energies not tied to a specific tradition of magic. Some items or effects are closely tied to a particular tradition of magic. In these cases, the item has the arcane, divine, occult, or primal trait instead of the magical trait. Any of these traits indicate that the item is magical.

traits.name: Sweep
traits.text: This weapon makes wide swinging attacks. When you attack with this weapon, you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to your attack roll if you already attempted to attack a different target this turn using this weapon.

ability.name: Battle Cry
ability.effect: Ordulf attempts to Demoralize an observed foe.

ability.name: Cleaving Blow
ability.text: Ordulf Strikes two adjacent creatures within his reach. Both attacks count against his multiple attack penalty, but do not increase his penalty until he has made both attacks.

ability.name: Crushing Insult

traits.name: Auditory
traits.text: Auditory actions and effects rely on sound. An action with the auditory trait can be successfully performed only if the creature using the action can speak or otherwise produce the required sounds. A spell or effect with the auditory trait has its effect only if the target can hear it. This applies only to sound-based parts of the effect, as determined by the GM. This is different from a sonic effect, which still affects targets who can’t hear it (such as deaf targets) as long as the effect itself makes sound.

traits.name: Linguistic
traits.text: An effect with this trait depends on language comprehension. A linguistic effect that targets a creature works only if the target understands the language you are using.

traits.name: Mental
traits.text: A mental effect can alter the target’s mind. It has no effect on an object or a mindless creature.

ability.effect: Ordulf issues a devastating and humiliating insult to a creature within 30 feet that he can see. Ordulf attempts an Intimidation check against the target's Will DC. That character is then temporarily immune to Crushing Insult for 24 hours.
ability.critical_success: The insult is distracting and humiliating; the target is stupefied 1 and off-guard for 1 minute.
ability.success: The insult is distracting, but its effects pass quickly; the target is stupefied 1 and off-guard until the start of Ordulf’s next turn.
ability.failure: The insult barely cuts, but is distracting enough that the target is off-guard until the end of Ordulf’s turn.
ability.critical_failure: Ordulf’s attempted insult fails spectacularly, and the PC who he was attempting to insult can instantly insult him back, using Insult Ordulf as a free action.

ability.name: Deadly Display
ability.requirement: Ordulf is wielding a melee weapon
ability.effect: Ordulf brandishes his weapon in a threatening display. He Demoralizes all enemies within 30 feet, rolling once and comparing the result to each target's Will DC.

ability.name: Whirlwind Strike
ability.text: Ordulf Strikes each enemy within his reach. Each attack counts toward his multiple attack penalty, but do not increase his penalty until he has made all his attacks.
